title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: button.DISPOSED which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a ( and that this matches "dispose()" far better than "DISPOSED". Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: When typing SWT code, the code assist feature automatically provides suggestions for auto-completion. I encountered an issue where the code assist feature selected "DISPOSED" instead of "dispose()" when I typed "button.". As a result, I ended up with incorrect code and had to manually delete it.
EB: The code assist feature should be smarter in determining the appropriate auto-completion suggestion. In this case, the code assist should have recognized that I was typing "button.dispose" and offered "dispose()" as a suggestion instead of "DISPOSED". Alternatively, the code assist feature could be made case sensitive to avoid such issues.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Open the IDE and start writing SWT code.
2. Type "button.dispose".
3. Observe the code assist feature and verify that it suggests "DISPOSED" instead of "dispose()".

Note: Ensure that the code assist feature is enabled in the IDE settings and that there are other suggestions available for auto-completion.
